title: You scared of playing ranked?
body: I'm still scared of playing ranked, what scared me most were time and losing LP. If someone is like this, scared of playing ranked actually don't play ranked, but play normal. The different between ranked players and normal players, ranked players are more serious to LOL, they are worrying the up and down of LP and to learn more about the game. But if you're a normal player don't worry about if you're friends are ranking you have to do the same. You have own more important things to do. In normal, if you don't troll pick and troll in game, you still can learn and improve. Overall of this game is not to raged at anything, get some rests for your eyes. Lastly, Stay focus and get some motivations to turn your life around.

replies.body:
I was intimated at first when it came to playing ranked, but I love competition and a challenge so I knew I'd always play ranked. Once I played, it definitely felt like there was more on the line. But that is why I like it, there are great moments of glory and moments of defeat. 

P.S. I lost all 10 of my promo games and got into b4, after that nothing really got to me in comparison.

you have been spared , you didn't get b5 xd
I believe it was a correct assessment. s5 the dream! >.<

I climbed from Bronze 5 to Gold 4.

Live the dream!

Also, be prepared for people losing their sh*t more often. Because you are assumedly less new to the game than your actions prove every so often and the monkeys will fling poop at you discontentedly.

How long did it take you to get to gold 4?

That is a very good tip and perspective, as I think along the same line as well. 

Sometimes I think, "These higher elo players must think I'm the biggest n00b". But along the way you meet some great players that are willing to lend a helping hand :)

About 2 Months. It wasn't that hard either, I slowly got used to different Champions and diversified my play pool a lot (Picking counters to certain Champions often gives you a huge advantage - especially in top lane where you are more or less on your own for the whole game).

Haha.

Yeah I've met heaps of nice players along the way and many an honourable opponent :p

Some games are land slides and some games appear to be over at Champ select or within the first 5 minutes but if you lay down a few strategies you can easily turn them around or beat those matches where their whole team has an edge over you. I've got a few ideas I keep fresh in my mind that I've learnt along the way, just general strats I'll call out like when to gank, split push or roam or w/e and have a lot of the same ideas for items for certain matchups along with playstyles or general strates like when to play aggressive, when to farm etc, when to call lane a loss and accept losing a turret and things like that, how to turn games :p)

I learnt a lot from the guides at Lolpro.com (Team Liquid formerly team Curse put up guides on this website) and when I first started out used mobafire to give me some ideas and there are heaps of tips on there too [although I prefer team Curse's quick concise tips etc]. Riot has good tips too like in the Champ spotlights and Dark horses section and now the added patch rundowns etc and my favourite place to visit for strats and mainly ideas and tips is leagueoflegends.wikia.com as it explains some more or less unknown mechanics of skills and kits along with info about how armor pen etc is applied mathematically and it can be valuable to know certain things when picking up or playing certain champs (Like Ahri's firefox applying full single target slow for each of the orbs etc with rylai's [it counts as a single target ability] and the page is full of little quirks and happenings like this.

Knowledge of the champions etc. is definitely holding me back. It's funny because I've purposely done that (to my detriment) because I don't want to know how every champion works. I like the idea that many parts of the game are still new to me. Like I played GP for the first time the other day and was like, "OMG I love himmmm". And when I got completely owned by a Morgana in one game, I was like, "who is this CHAMP?! I must learn her and own like she is"... and now she's my main :)

Yeah I use mobafire.com a lot, but might have to try out Lolpro.com based on your recommendation and what you've been able to achieve in just 2 months! :)

Haha.

Yeah a lot of my losses are mainly from playing Champs I'm not in-depth on and taking time to think out builds and stuff rather than concentrate on my play, but a lot of Champions you can carry over the ideas.

:p

I have played long enough to treat ranked like normals.


Im basically immune to all ragers/afk/feeders
Last time i got 2 afks and 1 intent feeder, not even mad, i just laughed at my team

So yea, if i lose in ranked, its fine, only a game. But since i main garen now, i only play him in ranked.
Normals is for screwing around i guess.

its not that scared to rank, if you have notice bronz to silver tiers  there are much more chance match up troller in your team than in a normal game . TBH unless you're a ex platnium+ player (for some reason you end up bronze now) and can win your lane with absolute advantage, then you can carry the team and your teammate won't troll because it look like no hope.
but really, not all of us are expert player, even we can win gold player while in custom 5v5 , we still cant win games in bronze tier.

dont play for lp/rank play to improve. You are only going to climb if you keep playing with a mindset that you are going to play normally this game and afterwards win or lose you will be able to see what you did wrong and what you did right and then translate that into your next game.

As long as you are constntly focusing on your play and not worrying about rank/lp you will climb faster then you would think

I play this game for fun and generally stick away from ranked because every time I've tried to play it, all my games have been toxic and the opposite of fun. It gets a little annoying when people think you're a bit shit just because you dislike the ranked environment even though you're ok at the game (I'm CERTAINLY not saying I deserve a good rank because I'm no master but I'm not a dead shit).
Tthank you so much for very positive comments,  might just limit myself from playing lol too often.
